doc.title: No Verb
doc.plot: No Verb" is an experimental, self-reflective, open plot documentary. Characters in this movie are residents of Burj Al-Berajneh Palestinian Refugee Camp in Lebanon. "No Verb" offers a glimpse of how this alienated community avoids the trauma of present by either reliving the memories of the past or escaping to a non-existent future. "No verb" doesn't talk about Israel, as if even talking about it would ruin the fragile poetry of everyday life. The whole movie can be summarized in the scene where an old lady is shouting to her son to "talk about Israel" and the son can only mumble unintelligibly in response.
